title: pkgdown example
text:
build(self)
Build index page, sphinx inventory, and individual doc pages.

title: pkgdown example
text:
get_object(module, object_name, parser='numpy', load_aliases=True, dynamic=False, modules_collection=None)
Fetch a griffe object.





Name
Type
Description
Default




module
str
A module name.
required


object_name
str
A function name.
required


parser
str
A docstring parser to use.
'numpy'


load_aliases

For aliases that were imported from other modules, should we load that module?
True


dynamic

Whether to dynamically import object. Useful if docstring is not hard-coded, but was set on object by running python code.
False


modules_collection
None
ModulesCollection
A griffe , used to hold loaded modules.






get_function: a deprecated function.



>>> get_function("quartodoc", "get_function")
<Function('get_function', ...

title: pkgdown example
text:
Builder(self, package, sections, version=None, dir='reference', title='Function reference', renderer='markdown', out_index=None, sidebar=None, use_interlinks=False, display_name='name')
Base class for building API docs.











Name
Type
Description
Default




package
str
The name of the package.
required


sections
list[Any]
A list of sections, with items to document.
required


version
str
None
The package version. By default this attempts to look up the current package version (TODO).


dir
str
Name of API directory.
'reference'


title
str
Title of the API index page.
'Function reference'


renderer
dict
Renderer
str


out_index
str
The output path of the index file, used to list all API functions.
None


sidebar
str
None
The output path for a sidebar yaml config (by default no config generated).


display_name
str
The default name shown for documented functions. Either “name”, “relative”, “full”, or “canonical”. These options range from just the function name, to its full path relative to its package, to including the package name, to its the its full path relative to its .__module__.
'name'

title: pkgdown example
text:
preview(ast, max_depth=999)
Print a friendly representation of a griffe object (e.g. function, docstring)


>>> from quartodoc import get_object
>>> obj = get_object("quartodoc", "get_object")
>>> preview(obj.docstring.parsed)
 ...
>>> preview(obj)
 ...

title: pkgdown example
text:
These functions inspect and parse docstrings.



get_object
Fetch a griffe object.


preview
Print a friendly representation of a griffe object (e.g. function, docstring)


Builder
Base class for building API docs.


Builder.build
Build index page, sphinx inventory, and individual doc pages.
